intro: Cacalia albida, commonly known as the white hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright white ray florets surrounding a central disc of yellow tubular flowers, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in meadows and grassy areas, preferring well-drained soils. Cacalia albida is often found in temperate climates and is valued for its ornamental qualities in gardens.
